summary: The Safer Response Act of 2025, introduced in the House of Representatives, aims to amend the Public Health Service Act. It focuses on reauthorizing grants for first responder training. The bill modifies existing provisions related to the training program, including updating terminology and changing funding amounts.  Specifically, it alters language regarding approved substances and addresses the training focus, particularly expanding the scope beyond opioids by including other drugs and renaming opioid overdose to simply overdose.  Finally, it increases the funding for the program.
